data.text: @gaijinfarang @AntonyGauthier2 @ThaiNewsReports You said "Total deaths". I thought from all causes, not covid. At any rate, in Thailand, as in other countries, you aren't considered vaxed til >14 days after jab. 0-13 days = unvaxed. Immediately post jab is when immune system weakest.
@Open_Media @ThaiNewsReports I'm not suggesting anybody  stop if that's what they want to do

@Vuedemonde1 @ThaiNewsReports Thais wearing masks for years because of the bad air, being it from traffic in the cities or burning of fields and forests. Nobody will stop doing so either. So better get used to it. I don't have a problem with it.

@Open_Media @ThaiNewsReports Not so much complaining I just don't see the point considering everybody is unmasked in restaurants and bars. The Thais I know aren't huge fans of masks outdoors, I think it will be a nice milestone when we can walk outside without them

@russxx @AntonyGauthier2 @ThaiNewsReports Total covid deaths in population over 60 from Jan 1 until Feb 18 2022.  What's doesn't make sense? Too few? 

https://t.co/jeLLXUmsxC
@gaijinfarang @AntonyGauthier2 @ThaiNewsReports 666 total deaths for over 60s? That makes no sense. 1500 die everyday in Thailand, ie > 70,000 up to feb 18, most of them old. What's your source?
@PattayaNewsFlas @Vuedemonde1 @ThaiNewsReports Nope, it only protects others from you coughing or spitting at the.
@Vuedemonde1 @ThaiNewsReports Anutin said there is no legal backing for a mask mandate, so up to you. But Thais actually do not have a problem with this, only farangs complain.

@Censored7770 @ThaiNewsReports Interesting and this coming from the WHO. I went to get my 3rd Pfizer yesterday and the lady at the counter even wanted to clarify to me that this vaccine is not designed for Omicron. Oh well, I kind of knew that but hope this is the last one I have to take.
